byline.contributor: Paul Mozur contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

abstract: Many Western governments and businesses oppose inclusion of word 'multilateral' in United Nations document defining how Internet is governed in future; language was largely brought about by China, which sought to enshrine state control of Internet in document.
lead_paragraph: Many Western governments oppose use of the word “multilateral,” which is considered code for nations making the rules on how people get online and who has access to data.

headline.main: At U.N., China Tries to Influence Fight Over Internet Control
headline.print_headline: Role for State in Internet Policy Shows China’s Influence at U.N.

snippet: Many Western governments oppose use of the word “multilateral,” which is considered code for nations making the rules on how people get online and who has access to data.
